metadata.title: CVE-2022-44792 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
handle_ipDefaultTTL in agent/mibgroup/ip-mib/ip_scalars.c in Net-SNMP 5.8through 5.9.3 has a NULL Pointer Exception bug that can be used by a remoteattacker (who has write access) to cause the instance to crash via acrafted UDP packet, resulting in Denial of Service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-44792` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.8
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.8
libsnmp30 - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.8
python-netsnmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.8
snmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.8
snmpd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.8
snmptrapd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.8
tkmib - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.8').
